intro: Asterocarpus nervosus, commonly known as the veined mountain vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
